edu.columbia.stat.wood.pub.util
Class DoubleStack

java.lang.Object
  edu.columbia.stat.wood.pub.util.DoubleStack

java.io.Serializable
public class DoubleStack
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Stack object for double native types.

Author:
nicholasbartlett
See Also:
Serialized Form

DoubleStack()
          Initializes the stack to have a capacity of 1024.

Constructor Detail

DoubleStack

public DoubleStack()
Initializes the stack to have a capacity of 1024. The implementation is array based but the underlying array will never shrink so should not be used in memory intensive situations.

Method Detail

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Checks to see if there is a next element.

Returns:
true of there is a next element, else false.

peak

public double peak()
Gets the next element but leaves it on the stack. This operation will fail if !hasNext().

Returns:
next double

push

public void push(double d)
Pushes a double onto the stack.

Parameters:
d - double to push

pop

public double pop()
Pops a double off the stack.

Returns:
next double

index

public int index()
Gets the index for the underlying array of the top of the stack. This is the index of the double that would be returned by calling pop() or peak();

Returns:
index

setIndex

public void setIndex(int index)
Allows you to arbitrarily set the index. Since pop() does not actually remove elements from the stack, it only changes the index, this is useful if you want to traverse the stack multiple times.

Parameters:
index - value to set underlying index to

print

public void print()
Utility method allowing you to print the underlying array.
